what: Benchmark Different Implementations of cone_radius — benchmark_cone_radius
title: Benchmark Different Implementations of cone_radius — benchmark_cone_radius
text: Benchmarks various implementations cone_radius function predefined sequence values number iterations. default, benchmarks implementations sequence 1000 values 100 iterations.

title: Benchmark Different Implementations of cone_radius — benchmark_cone_radius
text: implementations named list functions benchmark. Defaults : For_Loop: cone_radius_for Purrr_Map: cone_radius_map Apply: cone_radius_apply Direct_Vectorized: cone_radius_vectorized_direct Rcpp: cone_radius_cpp x_values numeric vector representing heights test (default: seq(0, 10, length.= 1000)). times integer specifying number iterations benchmark (default: 100). plot logical value indicating whether generate plot results (default: FALSE).

title: Benchmark Different Implementations of cone_radius — benchmark_cone_radius
text: microbenchmark object containing benchmark results.

title: Benchmark Different Implementations of cone_radius — benchmark_cone_radius
code: # Default benchmark benchmark_cone_radius() #> Unit: microseconds #>               expr     min       lq      mean   median      uq      max neval #>           For_Loop  97.021  98.7740 101.36031 100.2670 102.672  126.857   100 #>          Purrr_Map 627.510 646.7010 736.03521 665.0755 877.726  954.130   100 #>              Apply 607.914 616.8500 734.10686 637.6145 856.182 3803.203   100 #>  Direct_Vectorized  38.341  42.4595  61.75071  45.8105  88.781  109.755   100 #>               Rcpp   8.115   9.4475  12.24494  10.4750  13.014   73.146   100  # Custom benchmark benchmark_cone_radius(   implementations = list(     For_Loop = cone_radius_for,     Rcpp = cone_radius_cpp   ),   x_values = seq(0, 10, length.out = 500),   times = 50,   plot = TRUE )  #> Unit: microseconds #>      expr    min     lq     mean  median     uq     max neval #>  For_Loop 49.402 49.984 54.75128 50.6845 52.048 220.752    50 #>      Rcpp  5.591  5.730  6.43952  5.8960  6.182  24.907    50

what: Calculate the Radius of an Ice Cream Cone (Non-Vectorized) — cone_radius
title: Calculate the Radius of an Ice Cream Cone (Non-Vectorized) — cone_radius
text: Computes radius ice cream cone given height using non-vectorized approach. implementation evaluates one input value time, making less efficient large datasets.

title: Calculate the Radius of an Ice Cream Cone (Non-Vectorized) — cone_radius
Calculate the Radius of an Ice Cream Cone (Non-Vectorized) — cone_radius
text: x numeric value representing height cone.

title: Calculate the Radius of an Ice Cream Cone (Non-Vectorized) — cone_radius
text: numeric value representing radius cone specified height. Returns 0 invalid height values.

title: Calculate the Radius of an Ice Cream Cone (Non-Vectorized) — cone_radius
code: # Example usage cone_radius(5)  # Within the range 0-8 #> [1] 0.625 cone_radius(9)  # Within the range 8-10 #> [1] 2.262206 cone_radius(-2) # Outside valid range, returns 0 #> [1] 0

what: Calculate the Radius of an Ice Cream Cone (Apply Function) — cone_radius_apply
title: Calculate the Radius of an Ice Cream Cone (Apply Function) — cone_radius_apply
text: Computes radius ice cream cone given vector heights using sapply function. implementation applies custom function element vector using base R's sapply.

title: Calculate the Radius of an Ice Cream Cone (Apply Function) — cone_radius_apply
Calculate the Radius of an Ice Cream Cone (Apply Function) — cone_radius_apply
text: x numeric vector representing heights cone.

title: Calculate the Radius of an Ice Cream Cone (Apply Function) — cone_radius_apply
text: numeric vector representing radius cone specified heights. Returns 0 heights outside valid range.

title: Calculate the Radius of an Ice Cream Cone (Apply Function) — cone_radius_apply
code: # Example usage cone_radius_apply(c(-1, 5, 8.5, 9.5, 12))  # Returns radii for a vector of heights #> [1] 0.000000 0.625000 1.719138 2.496242 0.000000

what: Launch the Shiny App for Weather and Simulation Insights — run_app
title: Launch the Shiny App for Weather and Simulation Insights — run_app
text: Launches Shiny application included package, located inst/app directory. application provides weather insights three locations simulates resource requirements ice cream parties based weather conditions.

title: Launch the Shiny App for Weather and Simulation Insights — run_app
Launch the Shiny App for Weather and Simulation Insights — run_app
text: function return value; launches Shiny app.

title: Launch the Shiny App for Weather and Simulation Insights — run_app
text: Features app include: Weather Insights: View current weather 5-day forecasts (temperature, humidity, pressure) three cities using OpenWeatherMap API. Simulations: Estimate total ice cream volume chocolate coating requirements 99% events based weather conditions. Custom Visualizations: Interactive plots weather trends simulation results. run app, need valid OpenWeatherMap API key.

title: Launch the Shiny App for Weather and Simulation Insights — run_app

what: Simulate Ice Cream Parties Based on Weather Data — simulate_parties
title: Simulate Ice Cream Parties Based on Weather Data — simulate_parties
text: Simulates specified number ice cream parties based weather data, estimating total volume surface area cones required party. Weather data fetched OpenWeatherMap API, simulations run parallel efficiency.

title: Simulate Ice Cream Parties Based on Weather Data — simulate_parties
text: location character string specifying city name weather data (e.g., "Lausanne"). api_key character string representing OpenWeatherMap API key. n_parties integer specifying number parties simulate (default: 10000). epsilon numeric value small interval used surface area calculations (default: 1e-3). lower numeric value specifying lower bound integration cone volume surface area (default: 0). upper numeric value specifying upper bound integration cone volume surface area (default: 10). seed integer seed random number generation ensure reproducibility (default: 123).

title: Simulate Ice Cream Parties Based on Weather Data — simulate_parties
text: data frame containing statistics (mean standard deviation) total volume surface area cones.

title: Simulate Ice Cream Parties Based on Weather Data — simulate_parties
code: if (FALSE) { # Sys.getenv("OWM_API_KEY") != "" # Example usage: api_key <- Sys.getenv("OWM_API_KEY")  # Simulate 100 parties based on weather data for Lausanne results <- simulate_parties(   location = "Lausanne",   api_key = api_key,   n_parties = 100,   epsilon = 1e-3,   lower = 0,   upper = 10,   seed = 42 ) print(results) }
